concise_definition: adj. 左边的, 剩下的; n. 左边, 左派; v. 离开, 留下; adv. 向左

definitions.explanation_en: Located on or relating to the side of the body that is opposite the right side, typically the side where the heart is positioned.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指身体的左侧，通常为心脏所在的一侧，与右侧相对。
definitions.example_en: She turned left at the corner and walked down the street.
definitions.example_cn: 她在拐角处向左转，沿着街道走下去。

definitions.explanation_en: Remaining after others have been taken, used, or removed; not consumed or allocated.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在其他人或事物被取走、使用或移除后所剩下的部分，未被消耗或分配。
definitions.example_en: There were only a few cookies left after the party.
definitions.example_cn: 聚会后只剩下几块饼干了。

definitions.explanation_en: The side of the body or direction opposite to the right; often used in navigation, directions, or spatial orientation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指与右侧相对的身体一侧或方向，常用于导航、方向指示或空间定位。
definitions.example_en: The car parked on the left side of the road.

definitions.explanation_en: The political ideology or movement that supports social equality, progressive reform, and often opposes traditional hierarchies and conservative values.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指支持社会平等、推动进步改革、常反对传统等级制度和保守价值观的政治意识形态或运动。
definitions.example_en: The party has shifted toward the left on economic policy.
definitions.example_cn: 该党在经济政策上已向左翼倾斜。

definitions.explanation_en: To go away from a place or person; to depart, often permanently or for an extended period.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指离开某个地方或某人，通常指永久性或长时间的离开。
definitions.example_en: He left his job last month to travel the world.
definitions.example_cn: 他上个月辞去了工作，去环游世界了。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to remain behind when departing; to leave something behind intentionally or unintentionally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在离开时使某物留在原地，可能是有意或无意的。
definitions.example_en: She left her umbrella on the bus.
definitions.example_cn: 她把伞落在了公交车上。

definitions.explanation_en: In the direction toward the left; used to indicate movement or position relative to the speaker’s or subject’s left side.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指向左的方向，用于指示相对于说话者或主体左侧的移动或位置。
definitions.example_en: Turn left at the traffic light.

comparison.analysis: “Right”（右边）是 “left” 的直接反义词，用于空间方向、身体方位或政治立场的对立。在政治语境中，“right” 指保守主义，强调传统、秩序和自由市场，而 “left” 强调平等、改革与社会正义。在方向上，两者互为镜像，构成基本的空间参照系。
“Remaining”（剩余的）是 “left” 作为形容词时的近义词，但更正式、更中性，常用于书面语。而 “left” 更口语化，且隐含一种‘被遗弃’或‘未被使用’的情感色彩。例如：‘The remaining food’（剩余的食物）比 ‘The food left’ 更客观，后者可能暗示‘只剩这点了’的遗憾。
“Departed”（离开的）是 “left” 作为动词时的同义词，但更正式、更强调‘启程’或‘正式离开’的动作，常用于书面语或正式场合（如航班、死亡）。而 “left” 更通用，可指任何类型的离开，包括突然或非正式的。例如：‘He departed for Paris’（他启程去巴黎）比 ‘He left for Paris’ 更庄重。
